3D3161EEF7714D588913CCDA019FA21E.description: demonstrate an understanding of how our attitudes about mental health affect those around us and how they might contribute to or prevent creating stigma

3EB048399CE14F8DB3478963731EC086.description: identify personal and social factors (e.g., emotional, physical, mental, spiritual, cultural, legal, media, and peer influences) that can affect a person�s decision to drink alcohol or use cannabis at different points in their life

BD106C4452EB41059BD62593EA3A3E8D.description: explain how a person�s actions, either in person or online, including making homophobic or other hurtful comments, can affect their own and others� feelings, self-concept, mental health and emotional well-being, and reputation

281FF94865464DA58807DDD7AF9D7271.description: describe how advertising, food marketing, and media affect food choices (e.g., TV commercials, product packaging, celebrity endorsements and social media postings, product placements in movies and programs, idealized and unrealistic body images in movies and programs, magazine articles promoting fad diets, loyalty programs), and explain how these influences can be evaluated to help people make healthier choices

378D91DCDC6E4561A5A03C469A07042E.description: Making Connections for Healthy Living demonstrate the ability to make connections that relate to health and well-being - how their choices and behaviours affect both themselves and others, and how factors in the world around them affect their own and others� health and well-being.

AC52D55AF2474B39843C29E2727CF9B2.description: demonstrate an understanding of their role, and the limits of their role, in helping others who may need mental health support

77E5F2054D8D428FB7B1EFD5AC315D5F.description: describe emotional and interpersonal stresses related to puberty (e.g., questions about changing bodies and feelings, adjusting to changing relationships, crushes and more intense feelings, conflicts between personal desires and cultural teachings and practices), recognize signs that could indicate mental health concerns, and identify strategies that they can apply to manage stress, build resilience, keep open communication with family members and caring adults, and enhance their mental health and emotional well-being

F0A17549EBFF4B62B1A4D03977F7F2D2.description: identify intersecting factors that affect the development of a person�s self-concept, including their sexual orientation

B9E414A98FA14E44AA2DFE9351B0D9AE.description: demonstrate the ability to apply decision-making, assertiveness, and refusal skills to deal with pressures pertaining to alcohol use or other behaviours that could later lead to addiction

10BDFB5CF36C434C92B7B8580A566D90.description: demonstrate the ability to deal with threatening situations by applying social-emotional learning skills

D5A160C36D13435C9CD0392EF73309B6.description: explain how to use nutrition fact tables and ingredient lists on food labels to make informed choices about healthy and safe foods

62C79A77480C47C59E1A7046116734A5.description: Making Healthy Choices demonstrate the ability to apply health knowledge and social-emotional learning skills to make reasoned decisions and take appropriate actions relating to their personal health and well-being.

A6FA38985DF04791821AA4F444154F87.description: describe the processes of menstruation and spermatogenesis, and explain how these processes relate to reproduction and overall development

8C66041B9E364E098E682C05F6B292D4.description: identify the parts of the reproductive system, and describe how the body changes during puberty

FC30887F3C4C4B67977DDB127CA1B114.description: describe the short- and long-term effects of alcohol use, and identify factors that can affect intoxication (e.g., amount consumed; speed of consumption; sex, body size, emotional state; combinations with other drugs, such as cannabis, food, or substances such as energy drinks)

DA3C65F52CCA4C47AC93ED7CCBA31AF8.description: identify trusted people (e.g., parents, guardians, family members, neighbours, teachers, crossing guards, police, older students, coaches) and support services

2FD199EA7999420085453CF1ADEBBB08.description: Understanding Health Concepts demonstrate an understanding of factors that contribute to healthy development.

C35A8917CB894CC5B9D7A027187A2739.description: apply a variety of tactical solutions to increase their chances of success as they participate in physical activities

580828DB81094A8980FC6F9D334CD633.description: describe common features of specific categories of physical activities (e.g., individual, target, net/wall, striking/fielding, territory), and describe strategies that they found effective while participating in a variety of physical activities in different categories

BE40FBFD96D14BCDAED036A5F3551E28.description: demonstrate an understanding of the components of physical activities

E4B37BB1F37E4C4E9DC2737BCE8AC5CB.description: Movement Strategies apply movement strategies appropriately, demonstrating an understanding of the components of a variety of physical activities, in order to enhance their ability to participate successfully in those activities.

FA8D77DAA2C749A8A02CF8B1EE0A0F62.description: retain objects with and without equipment in a variety of situations while moving in different pathways around others and equipment

C991569985E844C08DD88783C7863A1A.description: send and receive objects using different body parts and equipment, adjusting for speed, while applying basic principles of movement

7E9B41DDB0D547C6824EF5174FB218E4.description: explore different combinations of locomotor movements with and without equipment, alone and with others, moving at different speeds and levels, and using different pathways

93D19C219E4E41F0A33B18EA7EDB28BF.description: demonstrate the ability to jump in control for height or distance, using a variety of body actions

9BFE9A3748CB428186B4BDD121ED2FD8.description: perform controlled transfers of weight in a variety of situations involving static and dynamic balance, using changes in speed and levels, with and without equipment

8902EE11C8524F1D9BDAA8BF99884DE8.description: Movement Skills and Concepts perform movement skills, demonstrating an understanding of the basic requirements of the skills and applying movement concepts as appropriate, as they engage in a variety of physical activities.

3B7715D95CD947A38197AED6455CFAB9.description: Movement Competence: Skills, Concepts, and Strategies

6E7483E01860495A9EF8C10275420C30.description: demonstrate an understanding of proactive measures that should be taken to minimize environmental health risks that may interfere with their safe participation in and enjoyment of outdoor physical activities

B90B01D6DC3E42EFB3DFB6387395B70A.description: demonstrate behaviours and apply procedures that maximize safety and lessen the risk of injury, including the risk of concussion, for themselves and others during physical activity

8C44F7572ECE4A3F993E6608FE39C397.description: Safety demonstrate responsibility for their own safety and the safety of others as they participate in physical activities.

03BBEF4736A04C5297190B3A61B22D25.description: develop and implement personal plans relating to a specific component of health-related fitness, chosen on the basis of their personal fitness assessments and interests

28B7A6F7366A4841A91EF56A07CCA9FC.description: assess a specific component of their health-related fitness

EA25A5CC5506402FBF67F9C803C4707E.description: identify the components of health-related fitness

AF8E9057650047B58DA7018DC75CA397.description: Daily physical activity (DPA): participate in moderate to vigorous physical activity, with appropriate warm-up and cool-down activities, to the best of their ability for a minimum of twenty minutes each day

913DA44F6264444BBD31D68212BDAF43.description: Physical Fitness demonstrate an understanding of the importance of being physically active, and apply physical fitness concepts and practices that contribute to healthy, active living.

B797E4CAC8D74270890D6F1D9D45A9D0.description: identify factors that can either motivate or make it difficult for people to be physically active every day

95AED937CCDB4611BD54E343364318EC.description: demonstrate an understanding of factors that contribute to their personal enjoyment of being active

0D1553BE14E549CBB94A72557D7FA85F.description: actively participate in a wide variety of program activities

C7AE09EDA1B04CB2AAB7FC9A8E5F7E20.description: Active Participation participate actively and regularly in a wide variety of physical activities, and demonstrate an understanding of how physical activity can be incorporated into their daily lives.

46566651743C4AFF88EBE15F3B462913.description: apply skills that help them think critically and creatively as they participate in learning experiences in health and physical education, in order to support making connections, analysing, evaluating, problem solving, and decision making

E436BD9F12C644AAA2746E985917E556.description: apply skills that help them develop self-awareness and self-confidence as they participate in learning experiences in health and physical education, in order to support the development of a sense of identity and a sense of belonging

8871A918D56747B5AF911B25FD9E5457.description: apply skills that help them build relationships, develop empathy, and communicate with others as they participate in learning experiences in health and physical education, in order to support healthy relationships, a sense of belonging, and respect for diversity

382F23DAB95E47C18471E86A986BFDDE.description: apply skills that help them develop habits of mind that support positive motivation and perseverance as they participate in learning experiences in health and physical education, in order to promote a sense of optimism and hope

658E691A561D4B959BC6BA77E7BBB3EB.description: apply skills that help them to recognize sources of stress and to cope with challenges, including help-seeking behaviours, as they participate in learning experiences in health and physical education, in order to support the development of personal resilience

D2820AB60B684B7694A2FD4147D98316.description: apply skills that help them identify and manage emotions as they participate in learning experiences in health and physical education, in order to improve their ability to express their own feelings and understand and respond to the feelings of others

3CD3F6A38D3F4B4A9945DDB3E62DC480.description: Social-Emotional Learning Skills apply, to the best of their ability, a range of social-emotional learning skills as they acquire knowledge and skills in connection with the expectations in the Active Living, Movement Competence, and Healthy Living strands for this grade.
